define-assembly.name: vendor
define-assembly.description: Information about a vendor of a computer part.

define-flag.name: id
define-flag.description: An identifier for classifying a unique computer parts vendor.

define-field.name: name
define-field.description: The registered company name of the vendor.

define-field.name: address
define-field.description: The physical address of an office location for the vendor.

define-field.name: website
define-field.description: A public website made by the vendor documenting their parts as used in the computer.

define-field.name: product-name
define-field.description: The product name from the vendor of the computer part.

define-assembly.name: computer
define-assembly.description: A container object for a computer, its parts, and its sub-parts.

define-flag.name: id
define-flag.description: An identifier for classifying a unique make and model of computer.

define-field.name: build-date
define-field.description: The date and time the computer build was completed.

define-assembly.name: motherboard
define-assembly.description: A container object for a motherboard in a computer and its sub-parts.

define-field.name: type
define-field.description: The type motherboard layout, at, atx, mini-itx or an alternative.

allowed-values.enum: Mini Information Technology eXtended Form Factor

define-assembly.name: cpu
define-assembly.description: The model number of the CPU on the motherboard of a computer.

define-field.name: architecture
define-field.description: The Instruction Set Architecture (ISA) of the processor, x86, x86-64, arm, or an alternative.

define-field.name: speed
define-field.description: The clock speed of the CPU in megahertz or gigahertz.

define-assembly.name: ata-socket
define-assembly.description: The model number of ATA socket on the motherboard of a computer. There will only be one socket on any motherboard.

define-field.name: type
define-field.description: The type of ATA socket on the motherboard , pata (parallel ATA), sata (Serial ATA), or an alternative.

define-assembly.name: memory
define-assembly.description: Random access memory hardware installed on the motherboard of a computer.

define-field.name: byte-size
define-field.description: Size of the memory module in binary, not SI base-10 units, meaning a kilobyte is 1024 bytes, not 1000 bytes.

define-assembly.name: expansion-card
define-assembly.description: The model number of an expansion card connected to the motherboard of a computer.

define-field.name: type
define-field.description: The type of expansion card on a motherboard of a computer, such as pci (PCI, e.g. Peripheral Component Interconnect), pcie (PCI Express), or an alternative.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: An identifier, based on a type 4 UUID, for the USB device.

is-unique.description: Ensures that each USB device has a unique UUID.

remarks.p: Warn if a model is not provided.
It is invalid to provide multiple models.

define-field.name: cost
define-field.description: The price paid in the specified currency.

define-field.name: remarks
define-field.description: Additional remarks related to the containing computer component.

define-assembly.name: property
define-assembly.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair.

define-flag.name: name
define-flag.description: A textual label, within a namespace, that uniquely identifies a specific attribute, characteristic, or quality of the property's containing object.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: A unique identifier for a property.

define-flag.name: ns
define-flag.description: A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

remarks.p: This value must be an absolute URI that serves as a naming system identifier.
When a ns is not provided, its value should be assumed to be http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.

define-flag.name: value
define-flag.description: Indicates the value of the attribute, characteristic, or quality.

define-flag.name: class
define-flag.description: A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the property's name.

remarks.p: This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of multiple properties of the same object with the same name and ns, or to group properties into categories.

A class can be used in validation rules to express extra constraints over named items of a specific class value. It is available for grouping, but unlike group is not expected specifically to designate any group membership as such.

define-flag.name: group
define-flag.description: An identifier for relating distinct sets of properties.

remarks.p: Different sets of properties may relate to separate contexts. Declare a group on a property to associate it with one or more other properties in a given context.

allowed-values.enum: A label or descriptor that is tied to a sensitivity or classification marking system. An optional class can be used to define the specific marking system used for the associated value.

remarks.p: Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order, and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure consistency.
Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context of the containing object.
